title: Privacy policy tracking issue

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-core
labels.description: Relevant to the core team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
A couple of Rust related websites use Google Analytics. Google's TOS [require you](http://www.davemulder.com/2010/07/01/using-google-analytics-wheres-your-privacy-policy/) to provide a privacy policy. I couldn't find any privacy policy for rust related websites, so I'm creating this tracking issue to track adoption of privacy policies.

Edit: the core team has decided to remove google analytics, see @steveklabnik 's [comment below](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/47347#issuecomment-373040646). Thus, this list now tracks which domain has no google analytics:

- [x] https://crates.io => https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io/commit/9ed7bbeb3768bf61d420526f58f600ae366e0ec5
- [x] https://www.rust-lang.org/ => https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-www/pull/1087
- [x] https://blog.rust-lang.org (https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/commit/7f30e2468e0f22a35741d2cfc399a88726a622d3) => https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/253
- [x] https://buildbot2.rust-lang.org
- [x] ~https://buildbot.rust-lang.org~
- [x] ~https://crater.rust-lang.org~
- [x] https://dev-static.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://doc.rust-lang.org ... no idea about this one it hosts a multitude of generated content. There might be google analytics hiding *somewhere* but I don't think so.
- [x] https://forge.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://internals.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://perf.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://play-next.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://play.rust-lang.org
- [x] ~https://playtest.rust-lang.org~
- [x] https://static.rust-lang.org
- [x] ~https://testsite.rust-lang.org~
- [x] https://thanks.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://users.rust-lang.org
- [x] https://xn--qei.rust-lang.org

doc.rust-lang.org seems to be clean. Haven't checked any other websites, so please feel free and edit this issue post and add them here if you find that they use google analytics as well.

Also, if it isn't enabled yet, I think that the "Mozilla feature" should be enabled in the interface (IIRC it was added on pressure by Mozilla), to prevent Google from using the collected data for other purposes.
